item.title: Cloudflare Zero Trust
item.description: Connect private networks 1. Set up the client Create device enrollment rules Create device enrollment rules to determine which devices can enroll to Zero Trust organization. Set device enrollment permissions In Zero Trust, go to Settings > WARP Client > Device enrollment > Device enrollment permissions > Manage. Rules > Policies > Add a rule > Include > Selector > Emails ending in > Value > @ruru910.com. 2. Route private network IPs through WARP In Zero Trust, go to Settings > WARP Client > Device settings > Profile settings > Profile name > Default > Configure.

item.title: Cloudflare tunnel on Synology
item.description: Setup Synology Create a directory in docker directory, such as cloudflare-tunnel. Download cloudflared/cloudflared image to registry. ssh to admin@synology Change cloudflare-tunnel owner, sudo chown -R 65532:65532 /volume1/docker/cloudflare-tunnel. Run containers - cloudflared tunnel login Run container and mount volume docker/cloudflare-tunnel:/home/nonroot/.cloudflared. Select Use the same network as Docker Host in network tab. Add command tunnel login in envorinment tab. Go to container log, and copy login url. Paste url to browser and authorize the zone.
